title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Temple of Love"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
inscribed: inscribed in pen and black ink, upper right corner: 39
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle: interior of huge vaulted temple, seen at an angle from right to left, inside monoptral building serving as a sort of altar; groups of people worshipping. (HH '39)

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Temple of Love".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-224.
